Take careWritten June 23, 2015This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of Tripadvisor LLC.Visited July 2014Traveled soloWritten June 17, 2015 - Super disappointing $100 facialBooked the mineral magic facial and the add-on fit face lift and left thinking.... is that IT?? The description on their website reads as follows, and I had to look at it a couple of times after the facial to make sure I had not received the wrong treatment by mistake... "Facial massage is adapted to the smaller muscles and thinner skin of the face with techniques that will plump, firm and stimulate circulation. Lymphatic drainage also reduces puffiness caused by excess fluids and specific targeted massage alleviates facial tension that not only improves aesthetics but also mitigates headaches. Elixir's Mineral skincare line, including the fabulous exfoliating mud mask, is naturally infused with over 80 trace minerals and elements to balance the skin and perfect radiant health." Basically it was someone cleaning off my face, putting a charcoal mask on and doing a very light head massage to eat up some time. When she cleaned the charcoal off my face she tried to explained that it was the exfoliation part of the facial. No targeted facial massage, definitely no lymphatic drainage. And I have never had a facial where they didn't put a headband on my face to keep my hair back away from the product - very odd! The rest of the time was spent doing the fit face lift with the "microcurrent technology". After they do one half of your face they give you a mirror to see how different it is from the untreated half. I could literally see no difference whatsoever and didn't see any difference in the mirror at home. And after she cleaned the gel from that off my face we were done. What... is that IT?? When the front desk asked me how it was I commented that it seemed very simple and no frills. That's when they told me they only had one aesthetician in the spa that day and sometimes the massage therapists fill in with the facials. So THAT's why it seemed like she didn't know what she was doing!! Totally not worth the $100 and can't say I will be back. If you book something just make sure you are getting the aesthetician and not someone "just filling in". Also, if you are looking for a true spa experience, be aware that between services you wait in the street-facing lobby, and sit in full view of the giant window, there are no robes and slippers to wear before/between, no relaxing quiet waiting room or shower/locker room. And you are offered water only, there are no snacks available of any kind, not even a cheap granola bar or cracker! Take your $$ elsewhere and pay a little extra for a full spa experience. This place is in not a "retreat" and you will not feel "pampered" as their website claims.
